input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command.
Refresh target, If no value is specified then both the computer settings and the user settings are processed. Valid Values: computer, user
Ignores all processing optimizations and reapplies all settings. Valid Values: true
Number of seconds that policy processing waits to finish. If no input is specified a default of 600 seconds is applied. 0 equals no wait
Logs off after the refresh has completed. Valid values: true
Restarts the computer after the refresh has completed. Valid values: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on Linux.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">echo Command not supported on SunOS.</xsl:text> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">gpupdate</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${refresh target}') != 0 and '${refresh target}' = 'computer'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /target:computer</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${refresh target}') != 0 and '${refresh target}' = 'user'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /target:user</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${force}') != 0 and '${force}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /force</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${wait}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /wait:${wait}</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${logoff}') != 0 and '${logoff}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /logoff</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${reboot}') != 0 and '${reboot}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /boot</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Update Group Policy Updates local Group Policy settings and Group Policy settings that are stored in Active Directory, including security settings.
